messages.subject: Re: More socks...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/23/2001 6:15:12 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... The advantage, of course, of wearing socks like this is that you always have another pair
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/23/2001 6:15:12 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> > > My daughter wears two different colored socks. She started it when she
> was
> > > 3 since she wanted more color in her outfits. Now it is part of her
> > > fashion. A couple of other girls she plays with have started it too.
> One
> > > is older and she made the comment that she didn't have to sort her socks
> > > now.
> > > I don't have to sort Megan's socks - they just go in a bin in her drawer
> and
> > > she picks out what she wants to wear that day.
>

The advantage, of course, of wearing socks like this is that you always have
another pair like it at home. Well, not really...but in theory...

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
